intro: Cupania stipata, commonly known as the stinging cup or stinging vine, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to the southeastern United States and parts of Mexico, where it typically grows in moist, shaded areas. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves with hairy surfaces. Its flowers are small, yellowish-green, and clustered in racemes, often producing a mild stinging sensation when touched. Cupania stipata is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and unique appearance.
